meanings.definition: Talk rapidly and continuously in a foolish, excited, or incomprehensible way.
meanings.sent1: During the party, the kids chattered about their favorite cartoons.
meanings.sent2: The students chattered happily after receiving their test results.
meanings.sent3: The parrot chattered away, mimicking the sounds of the household.
meanings.sent4: The brook chattered as it flowed over the smooth stones.
meanings.sent5: The monkeys chattered loudly in the jungle, creating a cacophony of sounds.

meanings.definition: Make a rapid series of short, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The birds chattered in the trees, announcing the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel chattered noisily as it scurried up the tree.
meanings.sent3: The old typewriter chattered away, filling the room with its clacking noise.
meanings.sent4: The rain chattered on the roof, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The machine chattered as it printed out the documents, signaling its efficiency.
